summary: Email correspondence between legal personnel regarding the status of FBI 302 reports and interview notes in the Epstein case. The sender provides attachments and requests missing notes from recent phone interviews, while the recipient's earlier email notes over 120 interviews have been conducted and identifies gaps in documentation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, is coordinating the collection and review of FBI 302s and interview notes for the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Review of Interview Materials
events.description: An email was sent acknowledging receipt of many FBI 302s, noting that over 120 interviews have been conducted in the case, and identifying missing reports and notes.

events.title: Follow-up on Interview Documentation
events.description: A follow-up email was sent attaching requested notes and 302s, and requesting notes from the last two phone interviews with unspecified individuals.

keyFacts: Over 120 interviews have been conducted in the Epstein case, indicating a large-scale investigation.
There are gaps in documentation, with some interviews having FBI 302 reports but no handwritten notes, and others having notes but no 302s.
The correspondence highlights ongoing coordination between legal personnel to ensure all investigative materials are collected and reviewed.
